newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-'Annus horribilus' over-Mt Edon Gold.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-'Annus horribilus' over-Mt Edon Gold.

text.p: Mount Edon Gold Mines (Australia) Ltd said on Wednesday it believed it was heading for a successful year after a difficult 1995/96.

"It has probably been the most difficult year in the company's history," chairman Trevor Kennedy told shareholders at the annual meeting, adding that he believed the company's problems were largely behind it.
"It was our 'annus horribilus'. However, unlike the British Royal Family, we believe we have put our problems behind us," Kennedy said.
Recent problems for the company included delays and increased costs involved in doubling the Tarmoola mine's production which coincided with the changing nature of the orebody at depth.
The company said this coincided with pit wall failure at the Nevoria mine and an elongated period of wet weather which severely hampered operations.
Both Tarmoola and Nevoria are located in Western Australia. Kennedy said the company had impemented a turnaround strategy with the September quarterly report providing evidence of progress.

"By September quarter it became apparent that the strategy we had adopted was putting the operation back on track. The September quarterly report provided evidence for our confidence," he told shareholders.
Mt Edon's September quarterly reported record gold output of 35,848 ounces with the company saying it had achieved substantial improvements and better performance from both mines.
Kennedy said the company's reserves inventory had increased to 1.118 million ounces of gold while the resource inventory had risen to 2.974 million ounces.
Mt Edon shares closed two cents higher oon Wednesday at A$1.66 on turnover of 1.17 million shares.
